result.execSummary:
The defendant Sandra G Sanford was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit DNA sample.  $65 blood draw reimbursement fee.

Huber privileges subject to jail policies. Consecutive to 19CT285.
Consecutive to: Count 1 of 19CT285.
Complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

chargeModifiers.descr: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (4th Offense)

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sandra G Sanford

records.addlTxt: Of right to preliminary hearing, filed by Atty Mark Lawton.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: entry made for purpose of closing the case.

2:36 PM Court called 19CT285 and 20CT34.  Defendant Sandra G Sanford in court.  Attorney Mark David Lawton in court for Sandra G Sanford.  Prosecuting attorney Jordan Lippert in court for the State of Wisconsin. State recited agreement.  New information to be filed.  Rights and elements.  Defendant plead no contest to count 1 in 19CT285.  Court accepted the plea and found defendant guilty of count 1 in 19CT285; judgment to be entered.  19TR4230 dismissed.  2:45 PM Court called new case 22CF500, appearances the same.  Waived reading of complaint.  Waived preliminary hearing, court accepted the defendants waiver of preliminary hearing and found probable cause and bound over for further proceedings.  Information filed; waived reading.  Rights and elements.  Defendant plead no contest to count 1 in 22CF500.  Court accepted the plea and found defendant guilty of count one in 22CF500; judgment to be entered.  20CT34 dismissed.  Sentencing statements. For 19CT285 Court ordered defendant to serve 45 days in the Columbia County Jail with Huber privileges subject to jail policies; to commence forthwith; pay fines and costs of $1744 and $65 blood draw reimbursement within 60 days or set up a payment plan with the Clerk of Courts; 24 month revocation of license, 24 month ignition interlock, complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations; submit DNA sample; 1 day sentence credit.  For 22CF500 court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the Columbia County Jail with Huber privileges subject to jail policies; consecutive to 19CT285; pay fines and costs of $2323 and $65 blood draw reimbursement fee with 60 day or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts; 24 month revocation of license; 24 month ignition interlock; complete an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations; submit DNA sample; 1 day sentence credit.  Any bond previously posted to be applied.  Adjourned at 3:00 PM.
